org.simonandrews.robolog

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simonandrews.robolog.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for doing logging stuff. You would make a new instance of it in your own code and then use it to send log messages.
    Author:
    Simon Andrews, Jake Kinsella

    • Constructor Detail

      • Logger

        public Logger(java.lang.String name)
        Logger. Can log messages.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the logger. This should usually describe the type of logs it will be sending (e.g. If you were logging messages about a dog named Rufus, the name of his logger would be "Rufus").

      • Logger

        public Logger(java.lang.String name,
              LoggingMode mode)
        Logger. Can log messages.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the logger. This should usually describe the type of logs it will be sending (e.g. If you were logging messages about a dog named Rufus, the name of his logger would be "Rufus").
        mode - The place where the logger should send logs to.

      • Logger

        public Logger(java.lang.String name,
              LoggingMode mode,
              java.lang.String outputFile)
        Logger. Can log messages.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the logger. This should usually describe the type of logs it will be sending (e.g. If you were logging messages about a dog named Rufus, the name of his logger would be "Rufus").
        mode - The place where the logger should send logs to.
        outputFile - The location of the logging file

    • Method Detail

      • dev

        public void dev(java.lang.String message)
        Code debugging information that would only really be useful to developers.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to log

      • info

        public void info(java.lang.String message)
        Just a regular old message. Can deliver good and bad news. Should be useful to non-developers.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to log

      • warn

        public void warn(java.lang.String message)
        Sends a warning to the log that something may be wrong. Not a serious issue, but should probably be fixed.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to log

      • error

        public void error(java.lang.String message)
        Report a error. An error is a serious problem, but one one that the program will attempt to continue despite of.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to log

      • fatal

        public void fatal(java.lang.String message)
        Report a fatal error. A fatal error is an error that the program can not recover from and must end because of.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to log

      • getFormat

        public java.lang.String getFormat()
        Gets the format of log strings.
        Returns:
        Log string formats

      • setFormat

        public void setFormat(java.lang.String format)
        Set the format of the log strings. The first %s is the level, the second is the name of the Logger instance, and the third is the message itself. For example "[%s] %s - %s" as the format will make log messages like "[INFO] MyLogger - This is a log message."
        Parameters:
        format -

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(Level level)
        Set the level of logging
        Parameters:
        level - the level you want to log at
